00036 #include "PACC/Threading/ThreadPool.hpp"
00037 #include "PACC/config.hpp"
00038 
00039 using namespace std;
00040 using namespace PACC;
00041 
00046 void Threading::SlaveThread::main(void) 
00047 {
00048     while(!mCancel)
00049     {
00050         // wait for available task
00051         mPool->lock();
00052         while(mPool->mTasks.empty() && !mCancel) mPool->wait();
00053         if(!mCancel)
00054         {
00055             // dequeu next task
00056             Task* lTask = mPool->mTasks.front();
00057             mPool->mTasks.pop();
00058             mPool->unlock();
00059             // signal all that task is running
00060             lTask->lock();
00061             lTask->mRunning = true;
00062             lTask->broadcast();
00063             lTask->unlock();
00064             // run task
00065             lTask->main();
00066             // signal all that task is completed
00067             lTask->lock();
00068             lTask->mRunning = false;
00069             lTask->mCompleted = true;
00070             lTask->broadcast();
00071             lTask->unlock();
00072         }
00073         else mPool->unlock();
00074     }
00075 }
00076 
00078 Threading::ThreadPool::ThreadPool(unsigned int inSlaves)
00079 {
00080     // allocate slave threads
00081     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < inSlaves; ++i) 
00082     {
00083         SlaveThread* lThread = new SlaveThread(this);
00084         push_back(lThread);
00085     }
00086 }
00087 
00089 Threading::ThreadPool::~ThreadPool(void)
00090 {
00091     lock();
00092     // wait for queue to become empty
00093     while(!mTasks.empty()) 
00094     {
00095         // wait for last task in queue to at least start running
00096         Task* lTask = mTasks.back();
00097         lTask->lock();
00098         unlock();
00099         lTask->wait(false);
00100         lTask->unlock();
00101         lock();
00102     }
00103     // now cancel all threads
00104     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < size(); ++i) (*this)[i]->cancel();
00105     // signal them to wake up
00106     broadcast();
00107     unlock();
00108     // then delete them (the thread destructor will wait for thread completion)
00109     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < size(); ++i) delete (*this)[i];
00110 }
00111 
00116 void Threading::ThreadPool::push(Task& inTask)
00117 {
00118     // reset task flags
00119     inTask.reset();
00120     // push task onto queue and signal availability
00121     lock();
00122     mTasks.push(&inTask);
00123     signal();
00124     unlock();
00125 }
